dashboard.description: Uploaded by https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/runbooks/-/jobs/563597872 at Fri May 22 10:11:44 UTC 2020

panels.description:
_Apdex is a measure of requests that complete within a tolerable period of time for the service. Higher is better._
  
### Component Thresholds  
_Satisfactory/Tolerable_  
 * high_urgency_job_execution: 10s  
 * high_urgency_job_queueing: 10s  
 * low_urgency_job_execution: 300s  
 * low_urgency_job_queueing: 60s  
 * throttled_job_execution: 300s

targets.expr:
min by (type) (min_over_time(gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{env="$environment", environment="$environment", monitor="global", stage="$stage", type="sidekiq"}[$__interval]))
or
min by (type) (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{environment="$environment", monitor!~"global|", stage="$stage", type="sidekiq"})
avg by (type) (avg_over_time(gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{env="$environment", environment="$environment", monitor="global", stage="$stage", type="sidekiq"}[$__interval]))

min by (type) (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{env="$environment", environment="$environment", monitor="global", stage="$stage", type="sidekiq"} offset 1w)
or
min by (type) (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{environment="$environment", monitor!~"global|", stage="$stage", type="sidekiq"} offset 1w)

panels.title: Latency: Apdex

panels.description: Error rates are a measure of unhandled service exceptions within a minute period. Client errors are excluded when possible. Lower is better

targets.expr:
clamp_max(
  max by (type) (max_over_time(gitlab_service_errors:ratio{env="$environment", environment="$environment", monitor="global", stage="$stage", type="sidekiq"}[$__interval]))
  or
  sum by (type) (gitlab_service_errors:ratio{environment="$environment", monitor!~"global|", stage="$stage", type="sidekiq"}),
  1
)

clamp_max(
  avg by (type) (avg_over_time(gitlab_service_errors:ratio{env="$environment", environment="$environment", monitor="global", stage="$stage", type="sidekiq"}[$__interval])),
  1
)

max by (type) (gitlab_service_errors:ratio{env="$environment", environment="$environment", monitor="global", stage="$stage", type="sidekiq"} offset 1w)
or
sum by (type) (gitlab_service_errors:ratio{environment="$environment", monitor!~"global|", stage="$stage", type="sidekiq"} offset 1w)

panels.title: Error Ratios

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.

targets.expr:
avg by (type) (avg_over_time(gitlab_service_ops:rate{env="$environment", environment="$environment", monitor="global", stage="$stage", type="sidekiq"}[$__interval]))
or
sum by (type) (gitlab_service_ops:rate{environment="$environment", monitor!~"global|", stage="$stage", type="sidekiq"})

avg by (type) (gitlab_service_ops:rate{env="$environment", environment="$environment", monitor="global", stage="$stage", type="sidekiq"} offset 1w)
or
sum by (type) (gitlab_service_ops:rate{environment="$environment", monitor!~"global|", stage="$stage", type="sidekiq"} offset 1w)

panels.title: RPS - Service Requests per Second

panels.description: Saturation is a measure of what ratio of a finite resource is currently being utilized. Lower is better.
panels.title: Saturation

panels.description: Percentage time the latency SLI for this service is within SLO
panels.title: 7d Latency SLA

targets.expr:
sort(
  max(
  ALERTS{environment="$environment", type="sidekiq", stage=~"|$stage", severity="s1", alertstate="firing"} * 4
  or
  ALERTS{environment="$environment", type="sidekiq", stage=~"|$stage", severity="s2", alertstate="firing"} * 3
  or
  ALERTS{environment="$environment", type="sidekiq", stage=~"|$stage", severity="s3", alertstate="firing"} * 2
  or
  ALERTS{environment="$environment", type="sidekiq", alertstate="firing"}
  ) by (alertname, severity)
)

panels.description: Percentage time the error ratio SLI for this service is within SLO
panels.title: 7d Error Rate SLA

panels.description: Apdex is a measure of requests that complete within a tolerable period of time for the service. Higher is better.

targets.expr:
sum by (component, type) (
  (avg_over_time(gitlab_component_apdex:ratio{component="high_urgency_job_execution", environment="$environment", monitor!~"global|", stage="$stage", type="sidekiq"}[$__interval]) >= 0)
  *
  (avg_over_time(gitlab_component_apdex:weight:score{component="high_urgency_job_execution", environment="$environment", monitor!~"global|", stage="$stage", type="sidekiq"}[10m]) >= 0)
)
/
sum by (component, type) (
  (avg_over_time(gitlab_component_apdex:weight:score{component="high_urgency_job_execution", environment="$environment", monitor!~"global|", stage="$stage", type="sidekiq"}[10m]) >= 0)
)

panels.title: high_urgency_job_execution Apdex

/
count by (environment, type, tier, stage, fqdn) (node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", environment="$environment", stage="$stage", type="sidekiq"})

/
count by (environment, type, tier, stage, fqdn) (node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", environment="$environment", stage="$stage", type="sidekiq"})

/

panels.title: loadavg15 per core

panels.span:
Average CPU per Node.

This resource measures all CPU across a fleet. If it is becoming saturated, it may indicate that the fleet needs horizontal or
vertical scaling.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      1 - avg without(mode, cpu) (
        rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", type!~"console-node|deploy-node", environment="$environment", stage="$stage", type="sidekiq"}[$__interval])
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{environment="$environment", stage="$stage", type="sidekiq", component="cpu"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: cpu component saturation: Average CPU Saturation per Node

panels.span:
Disk utilization per device per node.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, device) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      (
        1 - instance:node_filesystem_avail:ratio{fstype=~"ext.|xfs", environment="$environment", stage="$stage", type="sidekiq"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{environment="$environment", stage="$stage", type="sidekiq", component="disk_space"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: disk_space component saturation: Disk Utilization per Device per Node

panels.span:
Memory utilization per device per node.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      instance:node_memory_utilization:ratio{type!="monitoring", environment="$environment", stage="$stage", type="sidekiq"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{environment="$environment", stage="$stage", type="sidekiq", component="memory"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: memory component saturation: Memory Utilization per Node

panels.span:
Open file descriptor saturation per instance.

Saturation on file descriptor limits may indicate a resource-descriptor leak in the application.

As a temporary fix, you may want to consider restarting the affected process.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{environment="$environment", stage="$stage", type="sidekiq", component="open_fds"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: open_fds component saturation: Open file descriptor saturation per instance

panels.span:
Sidekiq worker saturation per node.

This metric represents the percentage of available threads*workers that are utilized actively processing jobs.

When this metric is saturated, new Sidekiq jobs will queue. Depending on whether or not the jobs are latency sensitive,
this could impact user experience.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, instance, pod) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      sum by (environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, instance, pod) (sidekiq_running_jobs{shard!~"export|elasticsearch|memory-bound", environment="$environment", stage="$stage", type="sidekiq"})
      /
      sum by (environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, instance, pod) (sidekiq_concurrency{shard!~"export|elasticsearch|memory-bound", environment="$environment", stage="$stage", type="sidekiq"})
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{environment="$environment", stage="$stage", type="sidekiq", component="sidekiq_workers"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: sidekiq_workers component saturation: Sidekiq Worker Saturation per Node

panels.span:
Average CPU per Node.

If average CPU is satured, it may indicate that a fleet is in need to horizontal or vertical scaling. It may also indicate
imbalances in load in a fleet.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      max without(cpu) (
        avg without(mode) (1 - rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", type!~"console-node|deploy-node", environment="$environment", stage="$stage", type="sidekiq"}[$__interval]))
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{environment="$environment", stage="$stage", type="sidekiq", component="single_node_cpu"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: single_node_cpu component saturation: Average CPU Saturation per Node

panels.span:
Puma worker saturation per node.

Each concurrent HTTP request being handled in the application needs a dedicated puma worker. When this resource is saturated,
we will see puma queuing taking place. Leading to slowdowns across the application.

Puma saturation is usually caused by latency problems in downstream services: usually Gitaly or Postgres, but possibly also Redis.
Puma saturation can also be caused by traffic spikes.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      sum by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (avg_over_time(puma_active_connections{environment="$environment", stage="$stage", type="sidekiq"}[$__interval]))
      /
      sum by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (puma_max_threads{pid="puma_master", environment="$environment", stage="$stage", type="sidekiq"})
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{environment="$environment", stage="$stage", type="sidekiq", component="single_node_puma_workers"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: single_node_puma_workers component saturation: Puma Worker Saturation per Node

panels.description: The total number of jobs in the system queued up to be executed. Lower is better.
panels.title: Sidekiq Aggregated Queue Length

panels.description: The number of jobs queued up to be executed. Lower is better
panels.title: Sidekiq Queue Lengths per Queue

panels.description: The amount of time a job has to wait before it starts being executed. Lower is better.
panels.title: Sidekiq Queuing Latency per Job

panels.description: The number of records waiting to be synced to Elasticsearch for Global Search. These are picked up in batches every minute. Lower is better but the batching every minute means it will not usually stay at 0. Steady growth over a sustained period of time indicates that ElasticIndexBulkCronWorker is not keeping up.
panels.title: Global search incremental indexing queue length

panels.description: Shows sidekiq worker saturation. Once saturated, all sidekiq workers will be busy processing jobs, and any new jobs that arrive will queue. Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(clamp_max(max by(shard, environment, tier, type, stage) (
  sum by (fqdn, instance, shard, environment, tier, type, stage) (sidekiq_running_jobs{type="sidekiq", environment="$environment", stage="$stage"})
  /
  sum by (fqdn, instance, shard, environment, tier, type, stage) (sidekiq_concurrency{type="sidekiq", environment="$environment", stage="$stage"})
)
,1),0)

panels.description: Percentage of time that resource is within capacity SLOs. Higher is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      gitlab_component_saturation:ratio:avg_over_time_1w{
        type="sidekiq",
        environment="$environment",
        stage=~"$stage|"
      }
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

targets.expr:
min by (type) (min_over_time(gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{env="$environment", environment="$environment", monitor="global", stage="$stage"}[$__range]))
